biogHist.abstract: Graceville Photos is a lever-arch file that contains information and images relating to the Salvation Army's Graceville Centre in Perth (Highgate). It also holds historical information relevant to the Salvation Army's Home of Rescue (East Perth) and Cornelie Home that preceded Graceville on the Lincoln Street site). This file is part of the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Children's Homes Files series of records held at the museum.
biogHist.p: Access to most items in the file is open, but it is essential to make an appointment to view.
Graceville Photos holds some documents as well as images. Some documents from the file are briefly described below:
This item gives insight into some major alterations, purchases and programs at the Graceville premises from 1898 (when it was the Cornelie Home) to after 1986.

This is an original Report giving an overview of the philosophy, aims, funding and operations of the Graceville Centre for the 1984-1985 year. It also includes a table of admission numbers (1974-1985) and some historical information (p.6) about the Salvation Army's Rescue Home in Summers Street (East Perth) and the Cornelie Home that became Graceville.

This is a pamphlet that outlines the services, routine and guidelines at Byanda, which was part of the Graceville Centre. The pamphlet is dated to the 1980s based on other items in the file which identify the managers of that period.

Newspaper Article: Eighty years of social service in West. Aust. remembered at the Graceville Centre

bibref.title: Eighty years of social service in West. Aust. remembered at the Graceville Centre

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Graceville photos file
archref.abstract: 'Graceville, 1973' is a digital copy of a photograph held in the Graceville photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The caption reads, 'Old Graceville, 1973' and is possibly the rear of the original Cornelie Home.

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Graceville photos file
archref.abstract: 'Graceville Women's Industrial Home' is a digital copy of an undated mounted print in the Graceville photos file held at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. It possibly dates from around the 1920, when a series of images of Homes were produced for a Salvation Army book, Property Souvenir Australia: a record of progress. It is not known when the image was mounted and labelled.
